Estimate size factors from control data

Source: R/normalization.R
estimate_size_factors.Rd

Estimates DESeq2 size factors using a subset of data (typically control oligos or neutral variants) for normalization across samples.

Usage

estimate_size_factors(
  count_data,
  col_data,
  design = "~ condition",
  min_row_sum = 10,
  reference_level = NULL
)

Arguments

count_data

A matrix of raw counts with genes/variants as rows and samples as columns.

col_data

A data frame with sample metadata. Must contain a condition column.

design

A formula string specifying the experimental design (default: "~ condition").

min_row_sum

Minimum total count across samples to retain a variant (default: 10).

reference_level

Reference level for condition factor (default: NULL).

Value

A named numeric vector of size factors, one per sample.

Details

This function creates a DESeqDataSet from the provided count matrix, filters low-count variants, and estimates size factors using DESeq2's median-of-ratios method. The size factors can then be applied to a separate count matrix for normalization.

See also

estimateSizeFactors

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
# Using synonymous variants for normalization
size_factors <- estimate_size_factors(
  count_data = norm_matrix,
  col_data = sample_info,
  reference_level = "Day4"
)
} # }
